sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Good morning, Europe. It's Wednesday, the 27th of April. I'm Raoul Sahn. It's great to have you with us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Let's take a look at our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russia cuts off gas supplies to Poland and Bulgaria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ukraine accuses Moscow of starting its blackmail of Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Fears of Russian intervention in Moldova after new attacks in the separatist region of Transnistria. And Brussels warns Elon Musk that Twitter will have to comply with European digital regulations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Poland and Bulgaria officials say Moscow is cutting off natural gas deliveries to the two countries from Wednesday due to their refusal to pay for them in rubles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They were informed of the decision by the Russian state-owned company Gazprom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The cut-off will hit supplies to Poland through the Yamal-Europe pipeline via Belarus and to Bulgaria via the TurkStream pipeline.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Poland has been receiving some 9 billion cubic metres annually, around 45% of its needs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Europe, especially Germany, buys large amounts of Russian natural gas, but Moscow had threatened to stop supplying what it called unfriendly countries over their support for Ukraine unless they paid in rubles rather than the usual euros or dollars. From September, Bulgaria plans to reduce reliance

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: on Moscow by importing cheaper gas from Azerbaijan via a connector running through Greece. The pipeline is in the final stages of construction and tests are already underway. Russian company Lukol Neftochim uses the oil port and refinery in Bulgaria's eastern city of Burgas on the Black Sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It operates through another Russian company, Litasko, registered in Switzerland, that so far allowed it to avoid sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: New attacks in Moldova's separatist region of Transnistria are raising fears of Russian intervention.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Two explosions rocked a radio facility on Tuesday 12 kilometers west of the Ukrainian border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: They followed several blasts on Monday in the strip where some 1,500 Russian troops are based.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ukraine has expressed concern and warned of a Russian attempt to drag the breakaway region into the war. We clearly understand that this is one of Russia's steps.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The special forces are working there. It's not just about fake news. And the reason is clear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In order to destabilize the situation in the region, to threaten Moldova by showing that if Moldova supports Ukraine, then they will take those steps." The United States has repeatedly warned that Russia could launch false flag attacks in nearby nations as a pretext for sending in troops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We reiterate the Moldovan government's call for calm in response to these incidents.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And we fully support, as you have heard us say before, Moldova's territorial integrity and sovereignty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We respect its constitutionally guaranteed neutrality.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We don't know all of the details beyond regarding what transpired yesterday, but we do remain concerned about any potential attempts to escalate tensions russia has admitted that wants to create a corridor from the donbass to the annexed crimean peninsula and will not stop until it seizes southern ukraine and links it with the prorussian breakaway region of transnistria in moldova Moldova. NATO's defence ministers met in Germany to discuss the basis for military aid to Ukraine as Russia's assault on the war-torn country enters its third month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Following a top-secret meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Sunday, the US Secretary of Defence Lloyd Austin stressed the importance of coordinated international support. We had a warm and candid and productive discussion with President Zelensky and his team about the support that we're providing, the capabilities that Ukraine needs, and Ukraine's changing requirements as the battle shifts to the Donbas and to the south, because we're going to keep moving heaven and earth so that we can meet them. We will now shift to the Donbass and to the south because we are going to keep moving heaven and earth so that we can meet them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Bundestag has been accused of failing to supply Kyiv with heavy weapons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: However German lawmakers have now agreed to offer Zelenskyy Gepard anti-aircraft systems from the country's military stocks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile Finland's navy is preparing for two days of war drills with the US-led alliance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Three NATO warships and two Finnish mine hunters will be used in the exercise, as Helsinki considers joining the 30-member partnership. Well, there seems to be an increased coordination amongst the countries that are trying to help Ukraine defend itself against the Russian invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: At a meeting at the Ramstein air base with defense ministers from NATO allies and other allied countries, the defense ministers agreed to meet on a monthly basis in order to discuss Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Also, Germany in a somewhat stunning change agreed to send heavy arms, this would be anti-aircraft tanks directly to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And in a separate meeting in Warsaw, the German economy minister Robert Habeck said that Germany is now close to becoming independent of Russian oil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And an export stop from Russia or an import embargo would not cause serious trouble for Germany anymore.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Jonah Calgren, Euronews Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres was in Moscow on Tuesday for meetings with Russian President Vladimir Putin and Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Putin said he agreed in principle with the UN and the International Committee of the Red Cross to evacuate civilians from the besieged port city of Mariupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Guterres and Putin discussed the situation at the Azovstal steel plant, where the last Ukrainian defenders of Mariupol are holed up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Russian leader acknowledged that the situation is tragic and said he still hopes for a positive outcome in Ukraine talks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: GUTERRES, Ukrainian President of the United States, Negotiations are underway.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: They are currently running online.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I hope that this will lead us to some positive result." But the United States says it does not believe Vladimir Putin is serious about meaningful negotiations in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: After his visit to Kyiv, the US Secretary of State Antony Blinken also reiterated his promise that US diplomats would return to Ukraine as of this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russia still has hopes for a diplomatic solution of the conflict in Ukraine, but will not sign a security guarantee agreement until the territorial questions of Crimea and Donbass are solved said Russian President Vladimir Putin at the meeting with the U.N secretary general Antonio guterres in Moscow President Putin also called the atrocities in boucher provocation against Russia and accused Ukraine of derailing the peace process. Antonio Guterres urged for an independent investigation of war crimes in Ukraine and proposed to involve the UN and the International Red Cross to evacuate people from the Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In the official statement following the talks, the UN said that Vladimir Putin in principle agreed to this proposal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: On Thursday, the UN Secretary General is expected in Kiev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Earlier, President Vladimir Zelensky had criticized Antonio Guterres for his decision to visit Moscow first.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Galina Polonskaya, Euronews from Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The head of the UN's atomic watchdog says Russian troops' occupation of the decommissioned Chernobyl nuclear plant in Ukraine two months ago was a potentially dangerous situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Rafael Mariano Grossi visited the site on Tuesday, on the 36th anniversary of the nuclear disaster at the facility. I don't know if we were very close to disaster but the situation was absolutely abnormal and very very dangerous. There were a number of events that were compromising the normal operation of any nuclear facility. Those were avoided but of course as I was saying just now, the situation is not stable, so we have to keep on alert.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russian troops had occupied the site in the exclusion zone near Kyiv for more than a month before the units withdrew. Ukraine's nuclear power plant in Zaporizhia, which is still operating, remains under Russian control. The Chernobyl meltdown in April 1986 is considered one of the largest civilian nuclear disasters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Tens of thousands of local residents were forcibly relocated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's still unclear how many people died from the long-term effects of the radiation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Estimates range from several thousand to tens of thousands.
